ari.ucidy

Enum UCDSyntax

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<UCDSyntax>
      • ari.ucidy.UCDSyntax
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<UCDSyntax>

    public enum UCDSyntax
extends java.lang.Enum<UCDSyntax>
    All possible syntax rules as defined by the IVOA Recommendation 2018-05-27 for the UCD1+ controlled vocabulary v1.3: http://www.ivoa.net/documents/UCD1+/20180527/index.html
    Version:
    1.1 (06/2018)
    Author:
    Grégory Mantelet (CDS)

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      BOTH
      The word can be used indifferently as first or secondary word.
      COLOUR
      A colour index ; can be followed by two successive word describing a part of the electromagnetic spectrum.
      PHOT_QUANTITY
      A photometric quantity ; can be followed by a word describing a part of the electromagnetic spectrum.
      PRIMARY
      The word can only be used as “primary” or first word.
      SECONDARY
      The word cannot be used as the first word to describe a single quantity.
      VECTOR
      A vector.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String allowedSyntaxCodes
      Human readable list of all possible syntaxes (in their character form) listed in this Enum class.
      protected char syntaxCode
      Character associated with this UCD syntax.

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • BOTH

        public static final UCDSyntax BOTH
        The word can be used indifferently as first or secondary word.

      • COLOUR

        public static final UCDSyntax COLOUR
        A colour index ; can be followed by two successive word describing a part of the electromagnetic spectrum.

        Implementation note: It will be considered as BOTH in term of order (i.e. its place in the UCD is not important).

      • PHOT_QUANTITY

        public static final UCDSyntax PHOT_QUANTITY
        A photometric quantity ; can be followed by a word describing a part of the electromagnetic spectrum.

        Implementation note: It will be considered as BOTH in term of order (i.e. its place in the UCD is not important).

      • PRIMARY

        public static final UCDSyntax PRIMARY
        The word can only be used as “primary” or first word.

      • SECONDARY

        public static final UCDSyntax SECONDARY
        The word cannot be used as the first word to describe a single quantity.

      • VECTOR

        public static final UCDSyntax VECTOR
        A vector. Such a word can be followed by another describing the axis or reference frame in which the measurement is done.

        Implementation note: It will be considered as BOTH in term of order (i.e. its place in the UCD is not important).

    • Field Detail

      • allowedSyntaxCodes

        public static final java.lang.String allowedSyntaxCodes
        Human readable list of all possible syntaxes (in their character form) listed in this Enum class.

      • syntaxCode

        protected final char syntaxCode
        Character associated with this UCD syntax.

        Note: the case of the character (i.e. lower or upper case) should not be important.

        public static UCDSyntax get(char syntaxCode)
        Get the Enum item representing the given syntax code character.
        Parameters:
        syntaxCode - The syntax code character for which the corresponding Enum item is asked.
        Returns:
        The corresponding Enum item, or null if none matches.

        Parameters:

      • values

        public static UCDSyntax[] values()
        Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared. This method may be used to iterate over the constants as follows: 
        for (UCDSyntax c : UCDSyntax.values())
    System.out.println(c);
        Returns:
        an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared
